sentences.en: Are you coming for a jog tomorrow morning?
sentences.cn: 明天早晨你来慢跑 吗 ?

sentences.en: As if to forestall any more questions, he began to jog through the sand.
sentences.cn: 象是为了免得对方再多问似的, 他索性在沙滩上小跑起来.

sentences.en: He reined in to a jog.
sentences.cn: 他勒紧马缰绳使马缓步前进.

sentences.en: He set off along the riverbank at a jog.
He tied a string on his finger to jog his memory.
sentences.cn: 他把一条细绳系在指头上,以唤起记忆.

sentences.en: He went for another early morning jog.
I gave him a jog to wake him up.
sentences.cn: 我轻轻推了他一下,叫醒他.

sentences.en: I go for a jog in the park every morning.
sentences.cn: 每天早晨我在公园里慢跑.

sentences.en: I jog every morning and play tennis every Saturday afternoon.
sentences.cn: 我每天早晨慢跑,每个星期六下午打网球.

sentences.en: I jog every morning before breakfast.
I jog every morning right about dawn to an hour after.
sentences.cn: 每天清晨我就起来,四处转悠一小时左右.

sentences.en: Mike goes for a two-mile jogevery morning.
sentences.cn: 迈克每天早上慢跑两英里。

sentences.en: Our lives just jog along from day to day.
sentences.cn: 我们的生活安稳地过了一天又一天.

sentences.en: They set off at a jog up one street and down another.
sentences.cn: 他们开始沿着一条又一条的街道慢跑。

sentences.en: This jog warmed me to a certain extent.

words.tran_cn: 慢跑者；[印刷] 撞纸机
慢跑；轻推；蹒跚行进；颠簸着移动
慢跑；轻推；蹒跚行进；使颠簸

trans.tran_en: a slow steady run, especially done as a way of exercising

trans.tran_cn: 轻推， 轻撞； 缓步前进， 慢跑
trans.tran_en: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising

trans.tran_cn: 慢跑，慢步长跑，轻推，轻撞
trans.tran_en: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising

trans.tran_cn: 轻推，轻撞，缓步前进，漫跑
trans.tran_en: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising
to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising
